data.title: About
paragraphs: I approach software development as a craft. Not just shipping features, but building systems meant to last.

I started my journey in Madagascar, working on real-world systems early on - where reliability wasn't optional and learning fast was a necessity. That foundation shaped how I work today: pragmatic, rigorous, and deeply focused on quality.
I've since worked across France and international teams, designing cloud architectures, modernizing legacy systems, and leading projects used by millions.
When I commit to a project, I treat it as my own.
